Bone morphogenetic proteins ( BMPs ) belong to the <extra_id_0> TGF-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> superfamily and are secreted proteins with pleiotropic roles in many different cell types .
A potential role of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the immune system has been implied by various studies of malignant and rheumatoid diseases .
In the present study , we explored the role of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in normal human peripheral blood B cells .

The B cells were found to express BMP type I and type II receptors and <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> rapidly induced phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> Smad1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> 8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: Furthermore , we found that <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> had an antiproliferative effect both in naive ( <extra_id_0> CD19 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + <extra_id_0> CD27 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - ) and memory B cells ( <extra_id_0> CD19 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + <extra_id_0> CD27 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + ) stimulated with anti-IgM alone or the combined action of anti-IgM and <extra_id_0> CD40L <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
Additionally , <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced cell death in activated memory B cells .

Importantly , the antiproliferative effect of <extra_id_0> BMP-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in B-cells was completely neutralized by the natural antagonist , <extra_id_0> noggin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
